provisioning_module.description: Web application used for creating Service Providers (SPs) and adding/managing applications. Manages SP details and Applications. Includes Service Provider profiles, SLA configurations, and Application provisioning.

requirements.REQ-SP-PRO-1: SP provisioning UI allows: Search SPs, Register new SP, View/Edit SP profile

requirements.REQ-SP-VIEW-1: Operations-User can search and view SPs
requirements.REQ-SP-VIEW-3: New applications can be created and existing applications viewed per SP
requirements.REQ-SP-VIEW-4: Provisioning state of applications can be changed

requirements.REQ-SP-REG-1: Operations-User can create and register new SP
requirements.REQ-SP-REG-2: Operations-User configures SP profile details during provisioning (see Profile_Attributes v0.5.xls, Service Provider tab)
requirements.REQ-SP-REG-4: General attributes of SP SLA must be configured
requirements.REQ-SP-REG-5: For each selected NCS, relevant SLA parameters must be configured
requirements.REQ-SP-REG-5.1: Configuring NCS SLA parameters is mandatory
requirements.REQ-SP-REG-6: Once configured, SP is created and email notification is sent to Operations-User and SP-User

requirements.REQ-SP-PRO-1: SP profile view available only to SP-Users
requirements.REQ-SP-PRO-2: SP-User can view profile details, SLA details, applications list, state of each NCS per application
requirements.REQ-SP-PRO-3: SP-User can modify limited attributes: company name, address, description

requirements.REQ-APP-MGT-1: Each SP can have max 2 SP-Users (configurable) who can create apps and participate in provisioning
requirements.REQ-APP-MGT-2: Application management UI allows: Create app, Search apps, Change requests
requirements.REQ-APP-MGT-3: Different user groups handle tasks in provisioning process
requirements.REQ-APP-MGT-4: Email notifications sent to relevant parties at each state

requirements.REQ-APP-CRE-1: Application ID auto-generated by system with unique numeric value; prefix differs for Testbed vs Production
requirements.REQ-APP-CRE-1.1: Separate IDs maintained for Testbed and Production
requirements.REQ-APP-CRE-2: SP-User must provide Application profile attributes
requirements.REQ-APP-CRE-4: SP-User must specify projected traffic parameters for each NCS (not part of SLA, but maintained separately)
requirements.REQ-APP-CRE-5: Once provisioning requested, SP-User cannot modify SLA (must use Change Request)
requirements.REQ-APP-CRE-6: Configurations can be saved as Draft before final provisioning request
requirements.REQ-APP-CRE-7: Provisioning request allowed only after all NCS details configured
requirements.REQ-APP-CRE-8: After request, other users access app to configure SLA parameters and state transitions

application_profile_attributes.description: Unique username required for CDR creation
Where app is hosted (M1, Singapore, Overseas)
How app connects (Leased Line, VPN, Internet)

requirements.REQ-APP-PRO-1: During provisioning, two SLAs created (Production and Testbed)
requirements.REQ-APP-PRO-2: Testbed and Production can be active simultaneously
requirements.REQ-APP-PRO-3: Database updated with timestamps for each state
requirements.REQ-APP-PRO-4: Parent SP ID, Testbed SLA reference, and Production SLA reference maintained

requirements.REQ-PRE-CRP-1: App must be in Limited or Active Production
requirements.REQ-PRE-CRP-2: No ongoing CR provisioning should exist
requirements.REQ-NEW-NCS-1: New NCS has its own independent state
